concept_data.title: verification of the regularity of an election

summary: The concept of "verification of the regularity of an election," commonly referred to as "election monitoring," pertains to the systematic assessment of electoral processes to ensure compliance with established legal and regulatory standards within the EU. This procedure is essential for upholding democratic principles, as it involves evaluating the integrity, transparency, and fairness of elections. Election monitoring can include observing voting procedures, scrutinizing ballot counting, and ensuring adherence to electoral laws. This concept is critical in fostering public trust in electoral outcomes and is often employed by various EU institutions to promote democratic governance across member states.
